goals: Demonstrate the competence in designing discipline-focused assessments.
Show the competence in developing assessment plans and items that are student-centered.
Display the understanding of assessment principles and related applications to facilitate student learning.
Present quality assessment artifacts which are involved with group efforts.
Show the mastery of skills in developing performance assessments that engage students to inquiry topics with interests.
syllabus:
**Instructor**

Dr Suyi Wang   王淑誼        Email: suyi.wang@ntnu.edu.tw

**Class Time**

Mon. 13:20-16:20

       **Credits**

3

**Objectives**

This course aims to study how the IB assesses students’ learning. Students will explore the philosophy, principles and practices of IB assessment and learn how to design and conduct assessments when teaching IB programs, including the diploma program (DP), middle year program (MYP) and primary year program (PYP). Students will construct their understanding, knowledge and skills for assessing students learning in their subject area of the IB program through inquiry-based learning.
